snippet: The 1902 Georgian-style East Side House Settlement, once an idyllic waterfront outpost of public charity, is now concrete-bound by six lanes of speeding traffic.
abstract: Christopher Gray Streetscapes column describes history of neo-Georgian structure built in 1902 on Manhattan's East side to house the East Side House Settlement public charity organization; notes that building's facade still survives, but is cut off from surrounding neighborhood by FDR Drive.
lead_paragraph: The 1902 Georgian-style East Side House Settlement, once an idyllic waterfront outpost of public charity, is now concrete-bound by six lanes of speeding traffic.

headline.print_headline: Look Quick, or Pray for a Traffic Jam
headline.seo: East Side House Settlements: A Sight to See When Traffic Stalls
headline.main: Look Quick, or Pray for a Traffic Jam
